title: Milton Keynes house party killings: Man, 21, charged over 'murder' of teenagers
text:

Police have charged a man with two counts of murder and two counts of attempted murder after two teenagers were stabbed to death at a house party in Milton Keynes.

Thames Valley Police have also arrested a second man in connection with the double murder investigation after the incident in the Emerson Valley area at close to midnight on Satuday.

A spokesman for the force said Charlie Chandler, aged 21, of Fitzwilliam Street, Bletchley, has been charged today with two counts of murder and two counts of attempted murder.

The charge is in connection with the incident at 11.59pm on Saturday, when officers were called to a report of a stabbing.

Two 17-year-old boys who have been formally identified as Dom Ansah and Ben Gillham-Rice sadly died.

(Image: Thames Valley Police)

One of the boys died at the scene and the other in hospital several hours later.

Detectives said Dom was knifed in the back and Ben was stabbed in the chest at the private 23rd birthday party.

Two other males, a 17-year-old boy and a 23-year-old man, also suffered injuries as a result of this incident and are recovering.

Chandler is due to appear at Milton Keynes Magistrates Court tomorrow.

(Image: Thames Valley Police)

A 22-year-old man, from Milton Keynes, has also been arrested on suspicion of murder and attempted murder in connection with this incident.

He remains in police custody.

The families of both boys have released a joint tribute to the teenagers.

Dom's family said: "Our loveable, cheeky son, Dom, was the light of the family’s life and the other half to Holly, his twin sister, who is only half the person she will ever be now that Dom has gone.

(Image: Vagner Vidal/Hyde News & Picture)

“Dom had big hopes and dreams for his future, which he will now never get to fulfil.

“There are no words to describe as a family how we will get over this.

“Dom was loved and cherished by his family and friends and will continue to be missed daily.”

(Image: Cliff Hide/LNP)

Describing Ben as a "gentle giant', his family said: “Our son Ben was a gentle giant with the most caring and loving nature you could have ever asked for.

“Ben will always be loved by all his family and friends, forever.

“Ben was a younger brother to Jake, who is absolutely devastated to have had him taken from him.

“We all as a family are blessed to have had our loving, funny, ambitious Benny Boy in our lives for the 17 years, and we are so devastated that he has gone.”
description: Two 17-year-old boys who were fatally stabbed were formally identified as Dom Ansah and Ben Gillham-Rice
